questions.question: Many animals in an ecosystem depend on other animals for —

choices.answer: air
energy
shelter
water

questions.question: Living and nonliving things interacting in an environment is called?

choices.answer: Organism
Ecosystem
Consumer
Producer

questions.question: Organism that gets energy by eating other organisms are called?

choices.answer: Producers
Consumers
Decomposers
Prey

questions.question: Organism that produces its own food are called?

choices.answer: Producer
Consumer
Decomposer
Prey

questions.question: Organism that consumes dead organisms are called?

choices.answer: Producers
Consumers
Decomposers
Predators

questions.question: Which describes a relationship in which one organism depends on another for its needs?

choices.answer: A rabbit burrowing in the ground
A hawk catching and eating a mouse
A frog cooling off in a pond
An oak tree absorbing sunlight for food

questions.question: Which is an example of an animal interacting with a nonliving part of its environment?

choices.answer: A lion catching and eating a zebra
A honey bee pollinating a wildflower
A coyote drinking water from a stream
A weed competing with a rose bush for space

questions.question: The soil on the prairie provides the grass with all of the following EXCEPT

choices.answer: Nutrients that help the grass live and grow
A place where its roots can hold the grass in place
Water retained in its pore spaces the grass can absorb
Energy that the grass needs to make its food

questions.question: How do beetles and mushrooms breaking down dead plants and animals help growing plants?

choices.answer: By returning nutrients to the soil
By releasing oxygen into the air
By making space for new animals
By decreasing the population of herbivores

questions.question: All of the following are examples of living things interacting with each other EXCEPT —

choices.answer: birds preying on insects living in the grass
squirrels spreading the seeds of trees by burying them
fish eating plants and other smaller fish
frogs sleeping in the mud at the bottom of the pond
